Primary prevention consists of encouraging sun prevention and the treatment of precancerous lesions (actinic keratoses, induced HPV viral lesions, etc.).

question.title: What is primary prevention for squamous cell and basal cell carcinomas?
question.description: Which option correctly describes primary prevention for squamous cell and basal cell carcinomas?

option_a.title: Encouraging sun prevention and treating precancerous lesions
option_a.description: This option describes a key aspect of primary prevention for squamous cell and basal cell carcinomas

option_b.title: Surgically removing precancerous lesions and promoting healthy lifestyle choices
option_b.description: This option is a common misconception about primary prevention, but it is not the correct approach

option_c.title: Encouraging sun prevention and promoting healthy lifestyle choices
option_c.description: This option is close, but it lacks the specific mention of treating precancerous lesions

option_d.title: Surgically removing precancerous lesions and promoting healthy lifestyle choices
option_d.description: This option is a common misconception about primary prevention, and is not the correct approach
